author: Steve
comment: Does not show my fb contacts..a fundamental problem! Support team  replied straight away saying it's a known issue but it's been weeks and still nothing. Also find navigation very strange, needs to be more simple/typical. Great idea and still the only app i can find offering these features. Just not executed terribly well at the moment unfortunately :(

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content:
Prior to April 15, we could show facebook contacts. Now facebook has limited ALL 3rd party apps from seeing your contacts. Facebook says this: We made this change because we heard feedback that people were surprised when their friends shared their information with an app. 
We working hard to improve Sparksfly everyday. Thanks for your comments.

title: Desperately wanted to like it, but..

author: Jennifer Kidd
comment: I downloaded this app because I was encouraged by the developers strong involvement. So, developer: why doesn't anything from Facebook show up in my feed. At all. It says its logged on. Everything looks green-go. But nothings there. And yeah, the navigation a little weird--no way to get back up the tree sometimes. Also can we expect other social media apps in the near future? g+? WordPress?  Edit: No, don't get any updates but twitter now. I wanted to like it too. So pretty.   But its dead, Jim.

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content:
Hey, could you send us an email to info@sparksfly.com? We would love to get you up and running again. 
G+ and other networks coming soon!

title: It's getting there...

author: Brett J Rea
comment: Shows great promise can't wait!! Only twitter and Instagram are showing up now not Facebook, plus I would prefer a newsfeed style, not cards, also buggy and lagging freezing up, still bonus for G+ integration. Also not updating last card was from a few hours ago... Facebook only showing my own posts...
title: Shows great promise but...

author: Brendan Smith
comment: Good app but it's been crippled by a power mad Facebook

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content: Brendan, yup. You are right about facebook. Good news, we've got 5 more networks in the works. Stay tuned.

title: Crummy Facebook

author: The Moistery Machine
comment: Every time i try to log in i get request failed.

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content: Hey, could you send us an email to info@sparksfly.com? We would love to get you up and running again. G+ and other networks coming soon!

title: Won't work

author: christopher farrell
comment: Hey i must have been away to long,  this one chic remember my member and she wants to come up and see if it is real
title: Sparks fly

author: Jose Pro
comment: Too complicated
title: Nice filter for our social newsfeed

author: Alberto Beck
comment: Image and video thumbnail quality is horrible. I Can hardly see what looking at.

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content: We have fixed the small images from facebook problem. Actually, facebook fixed it in their new API. All should be working properly now.

title: Poor images

author: Tamara Petrovic
comment: Would be great if you could comment and see other comments on FB and Instagram posts. Also, textual Twitter posts could be solidified into one page, so they wouldn't take up a whole page for just one short tweet.

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content: We will offer a list view option with multiple posts on a page in a future release. Comments are also on the works. Stay tuned.

author: V Fuentes
comment: Will rate higher when it supports instagram like it states
title: Meh

author: Richard Matchett
comment: Make a widget!

author: Astounding Moon
comment: No instagram like it states, just Facebook, twitter and linkedin.

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content: Instagram is indeed supported. It's not on the first on-boarding login screen, but as soon as you connect one network and setup your first feed, Instagram on the list of additional networks to add. Just take one more step and you will see it. :)

title: Looks cool BUT!...

author: alexis donkin
comment: Just wish it would a) not return to beginning when I reply to a tweet and b) automatically update when I open the app.

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content: You helped us find an old bug. We got it fixed now. Thanks!

author: Cleveland gravely
comment: It would be nice if we could comment, share to group or message and save pics, but overall it's nice

comment: I like the fact that I can organize what I see by topic or theme. Erases the noise, filters what's important to me...and best of all, saves me time!
title: This app really does simplify social feeds

title: Gondal

comment: "020414...all/one...I believe in simplicity...t/o...thanks..."
title: José A.

author: Kursheed Gee
comment: Pakistan.geonews

author: Basit Ijaz
comment: I must say... It's the most innovative social aggregation tool in Play Store. Refreshing UI which runs so smoothly. Great work.
title: Truly New

author: Paul Poutanen
comment: This App does everything it promises and more. I love it.
title: wow!

author: Kim Kobza
comment: Love it.
title: Greatly simplifies using social networks.

author: Christopher Woodside
comment: I installed and tried to like this but two main problems with Facebook make it useless. 1-no way to see comments or to make one, a pretty big feature of Facebook 2-all fb photo come in extremely pixelated to point that most are unviewable, even if you click the image to see it alone. If I still have to open the fb app, what's the point of this one?

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content: Hello, the facebook small image error is a bug in their API. We have an open ticket with them. facebook expects this to be resolved in the next week or so. Images will be full resolution. Comments will be supported in a future release. But hey, connect other networks. This app is about more than just facebook.

title: Good start but...

author: Chris Hayes
comment: This is STUPID!!!  You seriously expect to launch an app like this and only have 4 connections available? I mean it's a great idea but really only 4 connections ....why did you even bother? You should not have launched this app until you had at least a 10. And on top of that, why would I sign into this app to see Facebook and then I only see my own stuff instead of the stuff that's been posted on my timeline by friends and family?  Totally not whats its made out to be in the descrip.

reply.author: Sparksfly Technologies
reply.content:
Wow Chris, that's a pretty harsh review. 
Prior to April 15, we could show facebook contacts and friend feeds. Now facebook has limited ALL 3rd party apps from seeing your contacts. BTW if you connect more than one feed (facebook) you start to see the real benefits of Sparksfly. We working hard to add more networks Sparksfly everyday.

title: This must be a Beta and seriously lacking in usefulness.

author: La Tisha Parkinson
comment: 1)crashed twice in the first 5 mins of use. (2) I do not see all the people from my social networks (in order to make routines) (3) I create a routine and they tell me there is no content when ik there should be. There is far too much drama in just the start up of this app..I'm so disappointed because I was really excited, I thought this app would've been great :(
title: Doesn't work the way it says it would
